Table.name: Abstract_instrument_role
Table.commentInRDBMS: An Abstract instrument role is a role an Instrument may act in.

Column.name: Abstract_instrument_role_type
Column.comment: A discriminator to distinguish between Instrument role and OTC derivative role.

Column.name: Instrument_identifier
Column.comment: An identifier applied by the reporting agent to uniquely identify each instrument under a single contract. Each instrument must have one instrument identifier. This value will not change over time and cannot be used as the instrument identifier for any other instrument under the same contract.

Column.name: Reference_date
Column.comment: The date the data refers to.

Column.name: Reporting_agent_identifier
Column.comment: Identifier of the reporting agent.

Column.name: Instrument_role_type
Column.comment: A discriminator to distinguish between different roles an instrument may act in. Examples are financial asset instrument, financial liability instrument.

Column.name: Financial_asset_instrument_type
Column.comment: A discriminator to distinguish between financial asset instrument that have been recognised in the balance sheet and those that have not been recognised.

Column.name: Financial_asset_instrument_type_by_CRR,_Article_123_(Retail_exposure)
Column.comment: A discriminator to distinguish between financial assets that may potentially be classified as retail exposures and non-retail exposures.

Column.name: Financial_asset_instrument_type_by_interest_rate_only
Column.comment: A discriminator to distinguish between financial asset instruments with and without interest-only.

Column.name: Financial_asset_instrument_type_by_fixed_interest_rate
Column.comment: A discriminator to distinguish between financial asset instruments with and without fixed interest rate.

Column.name: Financial_asset_instrument_type_by_renegotiation_status
Column.comment: A discriminator to distinguish between financial asset instruments with and without renegotiations.

Column.name: Subject_to_impairment_indicator
Column.comment: Subject to impairment indicator indicates whether the Financial asset instrument is subject to impairment or not.

Column.name: Amortisation_type
Column.comment: Amortisation type of the Financial asset instrument including principal and interest.

Column.name: Financial_asset_instrument_Inception_date
Column.comment: Financial asset instrument Inception date is the date on which the current contractual relationship originated, i.e. the date on which the contract agreement of the Financial asset instrument became binding for all parties.

Column.name: Commitment_amount_at_inception
Column.comment: Commitment amount at inception is the Observed agent's maximum exposure to credit risk on the inception date of the financial asset instrument, without taking into account any protection held or other credit enhancements. Total commitment amount on the inception date is established during the approval process and is intended to restrict an observed agent's amount of credit risk to a given counterparty for the relevant instrument.

Column.name: Project_finance_loan_indicator
Column.comment: Project finance loan indicator specifies if the Financial asset instrument is considered a project finance loan or not.

Column.name: Purpose_type
Column.comment: Purpose type is the classification of Financial asset instruments according to their purpose.

Column.name: Exposure_with_recourse_indicator
Column.comment: Exposure with recourse indicator specifies if a Financial asset instrument is an instrument with or without recourse.

Column.name: Settlement_date
Column.comment: Settlement date is the date on which the conditions specified in the contract are or can be executed for the first time, i.e. the date on which the financial asset instrument is initially exchanged or created.

Column.name: Interest_rate
Column.comment: Interest rate is the annualised agreed rate or narrowly defined interest rate in accordance with Regulation (EU) No 1072/2013 of the European Central Bank (ECB/2013/34) that is applicable to the Financial asset instrument.

Column.name: Next_interest_rate_reset_date
Column.comment: Next interest rate reset date is the date that the next interest rate reset, as defined in Part 3 of Annex I to Regulation (EU) No 1071/2013 (ECB/2013/33), takes place for the Financial asset instrument. If the Financial asset instrument is not subject to a future interest rate reset, its legal final maturity date will be reported.

Column.name: Interest_rate_reset_frequency
Column.comment: Interest rate reset frequency is the frequency at which the interest rate is reset after the initial fixed-rate period, if any for the Financial asset instrument.

Column.name: Debt_financing_according_to_AnaCredit_indicator
Column.comment: Debt financing according to AnaCredit indicator specifies whether an Financial asset instrument is considered as debt financing according to Regulation (EU) 867/2016, allowed value for the data attribute purpose: "Financing of outstanding or maturing debt. This includes debt refinancing.".

Column.name: Payment_frequency
Column.comment: Payment frequency classifies the frequency of payments due, either of principal or interest, i.e. number of months between payments for the Financial asset instrument.

Column.name: Subordinated_debt_indicator2
Column.comment: Subordinated debt indicator specifies if the Financial asset instrument is considered as subordinated debt or not.

Column.name: Interest_rate_type
Column.comment: Type of interest rate classifies credit exposures based on the base rate for establishing the interest rate for each payment period.

Column.name: Past_due_financial_asset_instrument_indicator
Column.comment: Past due financial instrument indicator distinguishes Financial instrument into whether or not its payments are being considered late, or past due.

Column.name: Potential_retail_exposure_class_financial_asset_instrument_type
Column.comment: A discriminator to distinguish between different types of potential retail exposure class financial assets.

Column.name: Financial_asset_instrument_individually_assessed_type
Column.comment: A discriminator to distinguish between default and non-default financial asset instruments where an individual assessment (according to Regulation (EU) 575/2013, Article 178, subparagraph after (b)) has been chosen.

Column.name: Default_status2
Column.comment: A discriminator to distinguish between default because unlikely to pay, 90/180 days past due or both according to Regulation (EU) 575/2013, Article 178.

Column.name: Date_of_default_status
Column.comment: The date on which the default status is considered to have arisen.

Column.name: Accumulated_recoveries_since_default3
Column.comment: The total amount recovered since the date of default.

Column.name: Non-performing_prior_to_forbearance_indicator4
Column.comment: An indicator specifying if an exposure was non-performing prior to the extension of forbearance measures.

Column.name: Non-performing_exit_criteria_met_indicator4
Column.comment: Non-performing forborne exposures that failed to meet the non-performing exit criteria.

Column.name: Non-default_financial_asset_instrument_individually_assessed_type
Column.comment: A discriminator to distinguish between performing and non-performing financial asset instruments that have been individually assessed (according to Regulation (EU) 575/2013, Article 178, subparagraph following (b)).

Column.name: Date_of_non-performing_status3
Column.comment: The date on which the non-performing status has been applied.

Column.name: Non-performing_prior_to_forbearance_indicator3
Column.comment: An indicator specifying if an exposure was non-performing prior to the extension of forbearance measures.

Column.name: Non-performing_exit_criteria_met_indicator3
Column.comment: Non-performing forborne exposures that failed to meet the non-performing exit criteria.

Column.name: Performing_forborne_exposure_under_probation_reclassified_from_non-performing_indicator3
Column.comment: An indicator specifying if an asset is classified as Non-performing forborne exposure under probation reclassified from non-performing or not according to Regulation (EU) 680/2014, Annex V, part 2.260.

Column.name: Financial_asset_instrument_debtor_assessed_type
Column.comment: A discriminator to distinguish between performing and non-performing financial asset instruments where a debtor based approach has been chosen (compared to an exposure / individual approach according to Regulation (EU) 575/2013, Article 178 subparagraph after (b)).

Column.name: Accumulated_recoveries_since_default2
Column.comment: The total amount recovered since the date of default.

Column.name: Performing_forborne_exposure_under_probation_reclassified_from_non-performing_indicator2
Column.comment: An indicator specifying if an asset is classified as Non-performing forborne exposure under probation reclassified from non-performing or not according to Regulation (EU) 680/2014, Annex V, part 2.260.

Column.name: Date_of_non-performing_status2
Column.comment: The date on which the non-performing status has been applied.

Column.name: Non-performing_prior_to_forbearance_indicator2
Column.comment: An indicator specifying if an exposure was non-performing prior to the extension of forbearance measures.

Column.name: Non-performing_exit_criteria_met_indicator2
Column.comment: Non-performing forborne exposures that failed to meet the non-performing exit criteria.

Column.name: Non-retail_exposure_financial_asset_instrument_type
Column.comment: A discriminator to distinguish between performing and non-performing financial asset instruments that have not been classified as retail exposures.

Column.name: Accumulated_recoveries_since_default
Column.comment: The total amount recovered since the date of default.

Column.name: Performing_forborne_exposure_under_probation_reclassified_from_non-performing_indicator
Column.comment: An indicator specifying if an asset is classified as Non-performing forborne exposure under probation reclassified from non-performing or not according to Regulation (EU) 680/2014, Annex V, part 2.260.

Column.name: Date_of_non-performing_status
Column.comment: The date on which the non-performing status has been applied.

Column.name: Non-performing_prior_to_forbearance_indicator
Column.comment: An indicator specifying if an exposure was non-performing prior to the extension of forbearance measures.

Column.name: Non-performing_exit_criteria_met_indicator
Column.comment: Non-performing forborne exposures that failed to meet the non-performing exit criteria.

Column.name: Accumulated_write-offs
Column.comment: Accumulated write-offs is the Cumulative amount of principal and past due interest of any non-balance sheet recognised financial asset instrument that the institution is no longer recognising because they are considered uncollectible, independently of the portfolio in which they were included. Write-offs could be caused both by reductions in the carrying amount of financial assets recognised directly in profit or loss and by reductions in the amounts of the allowance accounts for credit losses set off against the carrying amount of financial assets.

Column.name: Balance_sheet_recognised_financial_asset_instrument_type
Column.comment: A discriminator to distinguish between balance sheet recognised financial asset instruments according to IFRS and nGAAP.

Column.name: Accounting_classification3
Column.comment: Accounting portfolio where the asset or liability is recorded in accordance with the accounting standard – IFRS or national GAAP –under Regulation (EU) 2015/534 (ECB/2015/13) applied by the observed agent's legal entity.

Column.name: Market_risk_induced_accumulated_negative_value_adjustments2
Column.comment: Accumulated negative value adjustments. Market risk induced

Column.name: Credit_risk_induced_accumulated_negative_value_adjustments2
Column.comment: Accumulated negative value adjustments. Market risk induced

Column.name: Accrued_interest2
Column.comment: The amount of accrued interest on loans at the reporting reference date as defined in Regulation (EU) No 1071/2013 (ECB/2013/33). In accordance with the general principle of accruals accounting, interest receivable on instruments should be subject to on-balance sheet recording as it accrues (i.e. on an accruals basis) rather than when it is actually received (i.e. on a cash basis).

Column.name: Fair_value_changes_due_to_hedge_accounting
Column.comment: Changes in the fair value of an asset or liability, which is a hedged item and measured at amortised cost, that are recognised in the carrying amount due to the application of hedge accounting (IFRS 9.6)

Column.name: Gross_carrying_amount_excluding_accrued_interest
Column.comment: Gross carrying amount, as defined in IFRS 9 appendix A, excluding accrued interest

Column.name: Impairment_status2
Column.comment: Type of impairment recorded in accordance with the accounting standard – IFRS or national GAAP.

Column.name: Accumulated_impairment
Column.comment: The amount of loss allowances that are held against or are allocated to the asset on the reporting reference date. This data attribute applies to assets subject to impairment under the applied accounting standard. Under IFRS, the accumulated impairment relates to the following amounts: (i) loss allowance at an amount equal to 12-month expected credit losses; (ii) loss allowance at an amount equal to lifetime expected credit losses. Under GAAP, the accumulated impairment relates to the following amounts: (i) loss allowance at an amount equal to general allowances; (ii) loss allowance at an amount equal to specific allowances.

Column.name: Carrying_amount2
Column.comment: The carrying amount in accordance with Annex V to Implementing Regulation (EU) No 680/2014.

Column.name: Balance_sheet_recognition_status
Column.comment: Balance sheet recognition of the financial asset.

Column.name: Prudential_portfolio_type
Column.comment: A discriminator to distinguish between trading and banking (or non-trading) book.

Column.name: Balance_sheet_recognised_financial_asset_instrument_by_fair_value_type
Column.comment: A discriminator to distinguish between different types of Balance sheet recognised financial asset instruments by fair value.

Column.name: Initial_impairment_status2
Column.comment: Initial imapirment status is the impairment status, recorded in the beginning of the financial year or at the initial recognition of the impairment of the exposure after the beginning of the financial year.

Column.name: General_allowances_for_credit_risk_affecting_carrying_amount
Column.comment: General allowances for credit risk affecting carrying amount.

Column.name: General_allowances_for_bank_risk_affecting_carrying_amount_(nGAAP)
Column.comment: General allowances for bank risk affecting carrying amount (nGAAP)

Column.name: Lower_of_cost_or_market_(LOCOM)_indicator
Column.comment: An indicator specifying if an asset is classified as lower of cost or market (LOCOM).

Column.name: Haircuts_for_trading_positions_valued_at_fair_value2
Column.comment: Haircut for trading position valued at fair value for the Balance sheet recognised financial asset instrument according to national general accepted accounting principles (nGAAP). According to Annex V (5.29): Where applicable under national GAAP based on BAD, ‘Haircuts for trading positions valued at fair value’ shall be reported. The haircuts decrease the value of trading assets and increase the value of trading liabilities.

Column.name: Fair_value_option_designation
Column.comment: Fair value option designation states the reason that the Balance sheet recognised financial asset instrument according to International Financial Reporting Standard (IFRS) is irrevocably designated a non-derivative financial asset instrument at fair value through profit or loss (use of fair value option).

Column.name: Held_for_sale_indicator
Column.comment: Indicates the Non-current assets and instruments in disposal groups classified as held for sale in accordance with IFRS5. Is not applicable under national GAAP based on BAD.

Column.name: Low_credit_risk_indicator_for_FINREP
Column.comment: Low credit risk indicator for FINREP signals loan or advance has low credit risk or not, according to the Banks' internal assessments.

Column.name: Fair_value_hierarchy3
Column.comment: Level of fair value of a financial asset or liability according to the hierarchy defined in IFRS 13. Applicable to national GAAP based on BAD only if the allocation of instruments is measured at fair value according to different levels.

Column.name: Fair_value3
Column.comment: Fair value as defined in IFRS 13.9.

Column.name: Fair_value_change2
Column.comment: Fair value changes in the period and before taxes.

Column.name: Accumulated_changes_in_fair_value3
Column.comment: Amount of gains and losses from re-measurement of the asset accumulated from the initial recognition to the reference date.

Column.name: Fair_value_changes_due_to_changes_in_credit_risk_before_purchase
Column.comment: Fair value changes due to changes in credit risk before purchase is the difference between the outstanding nominal amount and the purchase price of the Financial asset instrument at the purchase date.

Column.name: Accumulated_changes_in_fair_value_due_to_credit_risk2
Column.comment: Accumulated changes in fair value due to credit risk in accordance with Part 2.46 of Annex V to Implementing Regulation (EU) No 680/2014.

Column.name: End_date_of_interest-only_period
Column.comment: The date on which the interest-only period ends. Interest-only is an instrument for which, for a contractually set period, only the interest on the principal balance is paid, with the principal balance remaining unchanged.

Column.name: Renegotiated_financial_asset_instrument_type
Column.comment: A discriminator to distinguish between forborne and non-forborne renegotiated financial asset instruments.

Column.name: Date_of_renegotiation_status
Column.comment: The date on which the renegotiation status is considered to have been established or changed.

Column.name: Forbearance_measure_type2
Column.comment: A discriminator to distinguish between refinanced debt, instruments with modified interest rate below market value and other modified terms.

Column.name: Date_of_forbearance_measure
Column.comment: The date on which forbearance measure have been applied.

Column.name: Forbearance_measure_count
Column.comment: Number of times an exposure has been under forbearance measures. Exposures classified as forborne at the reporting reference date, to which forbearance measures have been applied at two, respectively more than two different points in time. That includes, among others, originally forborne exposures that exited the forborne status (cured forborne exposures), but were granted new forbearance measures after that.

Column.name: Multiple_forbearance_measures_in_place_indicator
Column.comment: Forbearance measures were granted in addition to already existing forbearance measures. It concerns forborne exposures under probation to which forbearance measures were applied in addition to forbearance measures granted at an earlier point in time, without the exposure having cured in between.

Column.name: Reference_rate
Column.comment: Reference rate used for the calculation of the actual interest rate.

Column.name: Interest_rate_cap
Column.comment: Maximum value for the interest rate charged.

Column.name: Interest_rate_floor
Column.comment: Minimum value for the interest rate charged.

Column.name: Interest_rate_spread_/_margin
Column.comment: Margin or spread (expressed as a percentage) to add to the reference rate that is used for the calculation of the interest rate in basis points.

Column.name: Arrears_for_the_instrument
Column.comment: Arrears for the instrument is the aggregate amount of principal, interest and any fee payment outstanding at the reporting date, which is contractually due and has not been paid (past due) for the Financial asset instrument. This amount is always to be reported. '0' is to be reported if the instrument was not past due on the reporting date.

Column.name: Date_past_due
Column.comment: Date past due is the date on which the Financial asset instrument became past due in accordance with Part 2.48 of Annex V to Implementing Regulation (EU) No 680/2014. This is the latest such date prior to the reporting reference date and it is to be reported if the instrument is past due on the reporting reference date.

Column.name: Freezing_period_in_days
Column.comment: Freezing period in days is the number of days (if any) for which the freezing period of the Past due financial asset instrument has been applied, in accordance with EBA guidelines 2016/07 paragraph 18.

Column.name: Financial_liability_instrument_type
Column.comment: A discriminator to distinguish between financial liability instruments that are recognised and that are not recognised in the balance sheet.

Column.name: Subordinated_debt_indicator
Column.comment: An indicator specifying if an asset is considered as subordinated debt or not.

Column.name: Balance_sheet_recognised_financial_liability_instrument_type
Column.comment: A discriminator to distinguish between fair-valued and non-fair-valued balance sheet recognised financial liability instruments.

Column.name: Accounting_classification2
Column.comment: Accounting portfolio where the asset or liability is recorded in accordance with the accounting standard – IFRS or national GAAP –under Regulation (EU) 2015/534 (ECB/2015/13) applied by the observed agent's legal entity.

Column.name: Accrued_interest
Column.comment: The amount of accrued interest on loans at the reporting reference date as defined in Regulation (EU) No 1071/2013 (ECB/2013/33). In accordance with the general principle of accruals accounting, interest receivable on instruments should be subject to on-balance sheet recording as it accrues (i.e. on an accruals basis) rather than when it is actually received (i.e. on a cash basis).

Column.name: Carrying_amount
Column.comment: The carrying amount in accordance with Annex V to Implementing Regulation (EU) No 680/2014.

Column.name: Fair_value2
Column.comment: Fair value as defined in IFRS 13.9.

Column.name: Accumulated_changes_in_fair_value2
Column.comment: Amount of gains and losses from re-measurement of the asset accumulated from the initial recognition to the reference date.

Column.name: Accumulated_changes_in_fair_value_due_to_(own)_credit_risk
Column.comment: Accumulated changes in fair value due to credit risk in accordance with Part 2.46 of Annex V to Implementing Regulation (EU) No 680/2014.

Column.name: Start_date_of_the_period
Column.comment: The start date of the period.

Column.name: Fair_value_designation
Column.comment: Defines the reason to irrevocably designate a non derivative financial instrument at fair value through profit or loss (use of fair value option). Is not applicable for nGAAP based on BAD.

Column.name: Fair_value_hierarchy2
Column.comment: Level of fair value of a financial instruments according to the hierarchy defined in IFRS 13. Applicable to national GAAP based on BAD only if the allocation of instruments is measured at fair value according to different levels.

Column.name: Fair_value_change
Column.comment: Fair value changes in the period and before taxes.

Column.name: Fair-valued_balance_sheet_recognised_financial_liability_instrument_accounting_standard
Column.comment: Fair-valued balance sheet recognised financial liability instrument accounting standard classifies the Fair-valued balance sheet recognised financial liability instrument according to the applied accounting standard (IFRS / nGAAP).

Column.name: Haircuts_for_trading_positions_valued_at_fair_value
Column.comment: Haircut for trading position valued at fair value for the Balance sheet recognised financial liability instrument according to national general accepted accounting principles (nGAAP) According to Annex V (5.29): Where applicable under national GAAP based on BAD, ‘Haircuts for trading positions valued at fair value’ shall be reported. The haircuts decrease the value of trading assets and increase the value of trading liabilities.

Column.name: Provisions_associated_with_off-balance_sheet_exposures
Column.comment: The amount of provisions for off-balance sheet amounts.

Column.name: Accumulated_changes_in_fair_value
Column.comment: Amount of gains and losses from re-measurement of the asset accumulated from the initial recognition to the reference date.

Column.name: Accumulated_changes_in_fair_value_due_to_credit_risk
Column.comment: Accumulated changes in fair value due to credit risk in accordance with Part 2.46 of Annex V to Implementing Regulation (EU) No 680/2014.

Column.name: Market_risk_induced_accumulated_negative_value_adjustments
Column.comment: Accumulated negative value adjustments. Market risk induced

Column.name: Credit_risk_induced_accumulated_negative_value_adjustments
Column.comment: Accumulated negative value adjustments. Market risk induced

Column.name: Fair_value
Column.comment: Fair value as defined in IFRS 13.9.

Column.name: Fair_value_hierarchy
Column.comment: Level of fair value of a financial asset or liability according to the hierarchy defined in IFRS 13. Applicable to national GAAP based on BAD only if the allocation of instruments is measured at fair value according to different levels.

Column.name: Impairment_status
Column.comment: Type of impairment recorded in accordance with the accounting standard – IFRS or national GAAP.

Column.name: Accounting_classification
Column.comment: Accounting portfolio where the asset or liability is recorded in accordance with the accounting standard – IFRS or national GAAP –under Regulation (EU) 2015/534 (ECB/2015/13) applied by the observed agent's legal entity.

Column.name: Initial_impairment_status
Column.comment: Initial imapirment status is the impairment status, recorded in the beginning of the financial year or at the initial recognition of the impairment of the exposure after the beginning of the financial year.

Column.name: Default_status
Column.comment: Default status distinguishes the Off-balance sheet item given instrument between default because unlikely to pay, 90/180 days past due or both according to Regulation (EU) 575/2013, Article 178.

Column.name: Performing_status
Column.comment: Performing status indicates how the off-balance sheet item given instrument performes in accordance with Implementing Regulation (EU) No 680/2014.

Column.name: Performing_status_reason
Column.comment: The reason for the choice of Performing status

Column.name: Forbearance_measure_type
Column.comment: A discriminator to distinguish between refinanced debt, instruments with modified interest rate below market value and other modified terms.

Column.name: Collateral_received_instrument_type
Column.comment: A discriminator to distinguish between different types of Collateral received instruments.

Column.name: Obtained_collateral_received_instrument_type
Column.comment: Obtained collateral received instrument type distinguishes Collateral received instrument whether it is a Collateral received instrument obtained by taking possession and Collateral received instrument that are not obtained.

Column.name: Eligible_as_guarantee_indicator
Column.comment: Eligible as guarantee indicator distinguishes the Collateral received instrument data into those where the Collateral received instrument, which is a Credit Default Swap, is eligible to be the a guarantee, or is not eligible to be a guarantee.

Column.name: Balance_sheet_recognition_date
Column.comment: Balance sheet recognition date is a date on which the Equity instrument that is not a security obtained by taking possession was taken into possession and thus recognised on the balance sheet.

Column.name: Derecognised_exposure_accumulated_impairment
Column.comment:
Accumulated impairment is the amount of loss allowances that are held against or are allocated to the derecognised exposure on the reporting reference date for which the Collateral obtained by taking possession has been obtained.
This data attribute applies to assets subject to impairment under the applied accounting standard. Under IFRS, the accumulated impairment relates to the following amounts: (i) loss allowance at an amount equal to 12-month expected credit losses; (ii) loss allowance at an amount equal to lifetime expected credit losses. Under GAAP, the accumulated impairment relates to the following amounts: (i) loss allowance at an amount equal to general allowances; (ii) loss allowance at an amount equal to specific allowances.

Column.name: Accumulated_fair_value_changes_of_the_exposure_due_to_credit_risk
Column.comment:
Accumulated changes in fair value due to credit risk in accordance with Part 2.46 of Annex V to Implementing Regulation (EU) No 680/2014 of the exposure that is derecognised because of the Collateral obtained by taking possession.
Note: This amount must only be reported when it is negative.

Column.name: Accounting_hedge_indicator
Column.comment: Accounting hedge indicator is an indicator specifying if the hedge is considered an accounting hedge or not.

Column.name: Type_of_hedge
Column.comment: Type of hedge applicable under the relevant accounting standard.
